title: Graduate Digital Solution Engineer 2025
description:
Join us as a Graduate Digital Solution Engineer and contribute to the design, development, and deployment of cutting-edge digital solutions—including generative AI applications—supporting the availability, reliability, safety, and cybersecurity of power generation systems across the EMEA region.
Working as part of our multi-disciplinary Engineering Team, you’ll gain hands-on experience with the TOMONI platform and other Mitsubishi digital tools while supporting real-world operations involving gas turbines, steam turbines, and generators. You’ll play a key role in creating technical solutions, supporting sales efforts, developing technical documentation, and travelling to client sites for on-site implementation and troubleshooting.
Key responsibilities
Support the implementation and ongoing maintenance of the TOMONI digital platform across customer sites.
Participate in the design and development of generative AI applications for internal and external use.
Troubleshoot technical issues in collaboration with the Digital Solutions team, including software, hardware, and cybersecurity-related challenges.
Prepare technical reports, procedures, and documents under the direction of the Engineering Manager.
Assist in sales support by preparing technical documentation and responding to RFQs and purchase orders.
Travel to customer sites for digital solution deployment, demonstrations, and technical support.
Participate in testing, setup, and in-house validation of digital solutions.
Collaborate cross-functionally with teams to support digital transformation initiatives.
Who we’re looking for
Essential requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Applied Mathematics).
Basic programming experience (academic or personal projects).
Foundational knowledge of statistics and machine learning.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and digital tools like Excel and Power BI.
Basic understanding of generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT).
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work both independently and in a team.
Desirable skills
Interest in industrial digital solutions (predictive maintenance, IoT, cloud-based systems).
Basic understanding of gas/steam turbines or mechanical engineering concepts.
Familiarity with IT & OT systems, TCP/IP networking, and cloud platforms (e.g., Microsoft Azure).
Experience with data visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Python libraries).
Exposure to AI agents, digital assistants, or workflow automation tools.
Basic cybersecurity knowledge.
Japanese language skills (optional but advantageous).
Personal attributes
A proactive learner with a passion for technology and real-world applications.
Willingness to be guided by senior engineers and managers.
Adaptability, curiosity, and a solution-oriented mindset.
About us
Mitsubishi Power headquartered in Yokohama, Japan, is a global leading company in the field of thermal power and environmental technologies. We can handle the entire production process from the development, design, manufacturing, construction and commissioning to after-sales service for thermal power plants.
The company has a total of 66 subsidiaries across 17 countries and was established as a joint venture in February 2014, bringing together the thermal power divisions of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd. and Hitachi Ltd.. Mitsubishi Power employs 18,300 staff worldwide and provides solutions for the improvement of operating thermal power generators using the latest digital technology.
Mitsubishi Power Europe is a 100% subsidiary of Mitsubishi Power. As a leading global company in the field of thermal power generation systems and environmental technology, we will continue to meet the expectations of our clients based worldwide in order to contribute to the future of a sustainable society.

tailoring_recommendations: Lead with your STEM degree and highlight coursework or projects in statistics, machine learning, AI or data science.
List programming projects (GitHub links if available) that show practical Python or ML experience—preferably projects involving time-series, predictive maintenance or IoT data.
Demonstrate experience with Power BI / Tableau and Excel: mention dashboards built, KPIs visualised and any measurable outcomes.
If you have cloud experience (Azure), describe services used (e.g., data storage, compute, model deployment) and scale.
Include any exposure to OT/industrial systems, networking (TCP/IP) or mechanical/turbine-related coursework or internships.
Describe any hands‑on experience with generative AI (ChatGPT prompts, prototypes, agents) and how you validated or integrated them.
Highlight troubleshooting, on-site support, or customer-facing experience; emphasise willingness to travel and examples of field work.
Add any cybersecurity fundamentals or certifications (even basic) to address security expectations.
Use ATS keywords from the job description verbatim in your CV (TOMONI, generative AI, Power BI, Azure, predictive maintenance, IoT, gas/steam turbines, RFQ, on-site implementation).
Quantify achievements where possible (e.g., reduced troubleshooting time by X%, improved model accuracy to Y%, delivered N dashboards).
Show soft skills with short examples: team projects, times you learned new tech quickly, or problem‑solving outcomes under guidance.
If applicable, mention language skills (Japanese) and global/cross-cultural experience to match the multinational context.
